channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: The music of Latin jazz pioneers lives on through sheet music from a small publisher
item.description: Steve Alcala, a music teacher and trumpet player, fell in love with Latin Jazz, but very little sheet music was available to help his students learn. So he started a sheet music publishing company.

item.title: Scientists celebrate a decade of listening to black holes
item.description: Researchers have spent 10 years improving the massive detectors they use to catch shockwaves from colliding black holes. Now the science is precise enough to test one of Stephen Hawking's key ideas.

item.title: Images of handcuffed workers after ICE raid at Hyundai plant sparked outrage in Seoul
item.description: Hundreds of South Korean workers are headed home after last week's dramatic immigration raid at a Hyundai plant in Georgia. The images of handcuffed workers sparked outrage in Seoul.

item.title: Shrinking middle class threatens U.S. stability, says Michigan Democrat Elissa Slotkin
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks to Sen. Elissa Slotkin, D-Michigan, about the U.S. intelligence community and national security.

item.title: The tension between security and free speech on college campuses
item.description: Colleges and universities often grapple with whether to invite controversial speakers on campus, usually allowing it given the First Amendment. How will this change the approach for such events?

item.title: Georgia built ties with South Korean companies over years. Then came the factory raid
item.description: Democrats and Republicans are walking a fine line when it comes to the politics surrounding the Hyundai plant ICE raid, because many in Georgia spent years building ties with South Korean companies.

item.title: Is 'Downton Abbey: The Grand Finale' as final as the name implies?
item.description: After six seasons on television, and now a third big-screen outing, the Crawley family saga has another installment with Downton Abbey: The Grand Finale.

item.title: What counterterrorism looks like in the U.S. 24 years after 9/11
item.description: The Sept. 11 attacks of 24 years ago led to unprecedented investment in counterterrorism resources. Today, the terrorism landscape is more complex than ever, and some say the country is less prepared.

item.title: For Charlie Kirk's followers, grief, shock and questions about the future
item.description: Charlie Kirk's followers are in shock and grief over his assassination. As they try to make sense of his killing, many are also asking what's next for the movement he started.

item.title: The life and legacy of Charlie Kirk
item.description: Charlie Kirk, who founded the campus activist group Turning Point USA, was arguably the most influential voice in young conservatism and played a pivotal role in President Trump's return to the White House.
